title: CRAwDAD: Causal Reasoning Augmentation with Dual-Agent Debate
summary: When people reason about cause and effect, they often consider many competing "what if" scenarios before deciding which explanation fits best. Analogously, advanced language models capable of causal inference can consider multiple interventions and counterfactuals to judge the validity of causal claims.
